title: Bitcoin Price Drops in Crypto Market
summary: Bitcoin, a popular digital money, dropped below $85,000 for a short time on Monday. This happened as many cryptocurrency companies and technology stocks fell in value. Bitcoin has lost about 33% since it hit a record high in October. Companies like Coinbase and Robinhood, which help people trade cryptocurrencies, also saw their prices go down. Some companies that focus on buying bitcoin, like Strategy, were affected too. Investors are pulling money out of bitcoin funds, and bitcoin futures are down, while gold is up. The article explains how this market drop is part of a bigger trend in technology investments.

background_read: Bitcoin is a digital currency created in 2009 that allows people to send money online without banks. Cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin use blockchain technology to keep transactions secure. The value of Bitcoin can change quickly based on how many people want to buy or sell it. Companies like Coinbase provide platforms for trading cryptocurrencies, and ETFs let investors bet on Bitcoin's price without owning it directly. Market sell-offs happen when many investors sell assets at once, often due to fear or economic changes.
Article_Structure: WHO: Investors, companies like Coinbase and Strategy, and cryptocurrency traders.
WHAT: Bitcoin's price dropped below $85,000, and related companies lost value in a market sell-off.
WHERE: In global cryptocurrency markets and stock exchanges, with mentions of Washington and online platforms.
WHY: Because of a broader decline in technology stocks and investors pulling money from bitcoin funds.

perspectives.description: The drop is part of a normal market cycle where prices go up and down based on investor behavior.
Cryptocurrencies are linked to tech stocks, so when tech falls, bitcoin often does too.
